attributes.action: Change PHE Guidance of PPE to better protect Healthcare workers on the Frontline
attributes.additional_details: There are too instances where carers, emergency workers and Health Care Workers are put into the difficult position between having to and wanting to care for a patient and their own health, lives and that of their families. Patients who are suspected to have Covid-19 but obliged to wear the minimal Personal Protective Equipment according to Public Health England's Guidance. This is until the patient is confirmed positive.
attributes.background: I would like Public Health England to change it's guidance on the wearing of PPE for Emergency, HealthCare Workers & Care Workers in Hospitals, Care Homes & the Community from just minimal PPE such gloves, apron & surgical mask only to full or maximum PPE to better protect Front-liners from Covid-19

rejection.details:
Guidance on Covid-19 and the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) is a matter for Public Health England, and not the Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Provide all workers dealing with the public PPE to be protected from COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307866

Protect essential workers from contracting and spreading Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306387

Supply PPE to all Health and Social Care workers including community carers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314229

Provide adequate PPE equipment for medical professionals working with COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304243

Provide urgent support and PPE to carers during coronavirus crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312960

Suitable equipment to protect our front-line police officers from COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310079

Fund and provide safety clothing for the supermarket staff on the frontline: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/305874

COVID-19: Commandeer production of British-made PPE for frontline staff: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312024

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
